item.title: Strugglingwriter add a quote by Suzanne Collins
item.description: "I no longer feel allegiance to these monsters called human beings, despise being one myself. I think that Peeta was onto something about us destroying one another and letting some decent species take over. Because something is significantly wrong with a creature that sacrifices its childrenâ€™s lives to settle its differences. You can spin it any way you like. Snow thought the Hunger Games were an efficient means of control. Coin thought the parachutes would expedite the war. But in the end, who does it benefit? No one. The truth is, it benefits no one to live in a world where these things happen." -- Suzanne Collins

item.title: Strugglingwriter add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "In the beginning there was nothing, which exploded." -- Terry Pratchett
